DataElement.preferredName: Continued Protocol Agent Administration Post Progressive Disease Diagnosis Agreement Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine whether a participant agreed to the continuation administration of a medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial subsequent to the recognition of the presence of a disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Continue Protocol Agent Administration Post Progressive Disease Diagnosis Agreement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption._A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.:A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.
A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Administration Post Progressive Disease Diagnosis Agreement
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

Concepts.definition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
